definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Deaf peple sometimes find it hard to get through to strangers.
sentences.chinese: 聋子有时很难使陌生人理解他们。

sentences.english: But I, as a deaf man, heard not; and I was as a dumb man that openeth not his mouth.
sentences.chinese: 但我如聋子不听，像哑吧不开口。

sentences.english: Helen Keller became blind and deaf. She couldn't see and she couldn't hear.
sentences.chinese: 海伦凯勒成为盲人和聋子，他不能看也不能听。

sentences.english: If the deaf could hear, the blind would be able to see, too.
sentences.chinese: 如果聋子可以听到，那么盲人也会能够看的见了。

sentences.english: But such calls for national unity are falling on deaf ears.
sentences.chinese: 但是这种全国一条心的呼吁正进了聋子耳朵。

sentences.english: Go away, I'm screaming. Haven't you heard?
sentences.chinese: 我对他大叫道，“滚，你是聋子么？

sentences.english: As far as Jieyu's experience is concerned, you are blind and deaf.
sentences.chinese: 在接舆的经验层面上，你就是个瞎子，就是聋子。

sentences.english: Beneath (Underneath) the wreath the deaf man near death is out of breath.
sentences.chinese: 花环下面那个快要逝世的聋子喘不外气来。

sentences.english: It's no use abusing fate, for it is a deaf.
sentences.chinese: 向命运叫骂无济于事呢，因为命运是个聋子。

sentences.english: Beneath ( Underneath) the  wreath the  deaf man near death is out of  breath.
sentences.chinese: 花环下面那个快要死的聋子喘不过气来。

sentences.english: He spoke to me as if I were (was) deaf.
sentences.chinese: 他跟我说话时就象我是聋子似的。

sentences.english: The deaf hear mute said the blind saw loveqiywm. cn.
sentences.chinese: 聋子闻声哑巴说瞎子看见了爱情。

sentences.english: Kindness is the language that the deaf can hear and the dumb understand.
sentences.chinese: 善良是一种语言，聋子能天见哑巴懂心间。

definition: mute person/dumb person/(more commonly called 啞巴|哑巴[ya3 ba5])
